article_title: Zonda, One of Europe's Largest Crypto Exchanges, Expands to Denmark - CoinCodex
text:
Zonda, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in Eastern and Central Europe with more than 1 million users, continues its global expansion with its new Danish office. Cornering the Eastern European market, Zonda is strengthening its European footprint by opening an office in the country’s capital, Copenhagen.

The newly-opened office is the result of the exchange's desire to stand out in the Northern European market. The Danish office will consist of a team of developers who will work with CTO Jakob Lundqvist to enhance the platform's technical capabilities.

Zonda is focused on streamlining access to crypto assets and providing a user-friendly gateway to crypto investing. Image source: Zonda

Best Regulated Exchange in Europe

Zonda's two biggest goals are to be the best-regulated exchange in Europe and to be the most technologically advanced exchange that offers the most possibilities to its users. The Zonda ecosystem has been growing and developing since its launch. Currently, the ecosystem includes offers for corporate and individual customers, the ZondaPay application developed for retailers, and Zonda Academy for educational purposes. New developments are focused on customer and investment security.

Working out of the Danish office, the experienced technology team is taksed with helping Zonda achieve these goals. Zonda's expansion efforts have gained momentum recently – a recent move to the Italian market, regulatory approval to operate in Canada, and now the opening of its Danish office are some of Zonda's recent expansion efforts. In addition, the company is in the process of obtaining additional licenses to operate in Switzerland and the UK.

Zonda CTO Jakob Lundqvist has this to say about expanding to Denmark:

"When working as a CTO, it's important to use a private office where I can work closely with our talented team members, especially when so much work is done remotely these days. Our modern, fully equipped office provides the perfect place to focus on advancing Zonda's technological aspirations and developing the tools needed to compete on the world stage."

More About Zonda

Zonda is one of Europe's largest digital asset investment platforms. Zonda offers investors the ability to trade BTC and ETH in pairs with over 60 cryptocurrencies, fiat and stablecoins (USDT and USDC). Also tasked with democratizing access to cryptocurrencies, the aim of the exchange is to develop educational programs and simple intuitive tools that help customers trade and spend with confidence, while being compliant with regulatory frameworks.

article_title: Making Web3 Closer: A Look Inside NEAR Protocol’s Ecosystem with Hundreds of Use Cases for DApps - CoinCodex
text:
The internet that we know today is gradually evolving towards a fundamentally new concept with decentralized technologies like blockchain, cryptocurrencies and NFTs ruling the roost. Started as a solution that redefines the nature of money and finance, today blockchain becomes more deeply ingrained in our lives, revolutionizing the way people interact with Web2.

Despite the ongoing pace of Web3 adoption outruns early adoption rates of the internet, there are still some pain points that prevent people from immersing themselves in this idea en masse. In order to successfully onboard millions of users and ensure their experience is hassle-free and seamless, effective solutions are needed that address knowledge gaps and blockchain scalability issues.

This is why the emergence of NEAR Protocol in 2020 has become the talk of the town in the industry, which, though it has a few scalability methods already deployed, still needed a solution with potentially unlimited capacity. Helping developers, entrepreneurs and end-users carve the pave to Web3 that is open-sourced, decentralized, and supposed to be much more secure, the NEAR team aims to attract at least 1 billion users to its platform and make mainstream adoption of a new iteration of the internet a reality.

In this article, we’ll plunge into the NEAR ecosystem and evaluate its impact on the future of Web3.

What Is NEAR Protocol (NEAR)?

NEAR Protocol is a smart contract-capable platform designed for developers with various skill levels when it comes to blockchain and crypto. Due to its own consensus mechanism called Doomslug and specially created NEAR SDK, DApps can be created within just 5 minutes and coded with the most familiar languages, such as JavaScript, Rust and Solidity.

Being today’s most scalable blockchain, NEAR Protocol uses sharding technology to process more then 100,000 transactions per second simultaneously without compromising security while maintaining low transaction costs. The project is considered to be a serious competitor to Ethereum and so-called Ethereum killers, including Cardano, Polkadot, Solana, Cosmos, and Avalanche, none of these are even close to having NEAR’s throughput.

The network charges fees in NEAR tokens for storing data and completing transactions within the ecosystem. Currently, there are 781 million coins in circulation which constitutes 79% of a total supply which is 1 billion NEAR tokens created at genesis. The model that underlies NEAR’s tokenomics implies issuing a 5% additional supply of tokens annually to further reward validators, while a portion of network fees in NEAR are burned to maintain scarcity.

Besides, NEAR token holders can stake their assets to participate in securing the network and receive rewards. According to Staking Rewards, the current annualized return from staking on NEAR is 10%.

Aurora

Aurora is a layer-2 solution that allows for creating Ethereum smart contracts in the NEAR network. In fact, this is an advanced Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) implemented as a smart contract on NEAR that helps with scaling Ethereum ecosystem for developers who can now expand their DApps without the need to rewrite them or examine Web3 tools as well as benefit from high capacity and low fees.

The solution is composed of the Aurora Engine which ensures full compatibility with Ethereum and the Aurora Bridge which is used to transfer smart contracts. Transactions on Aurora are executed within 2 seconds and cost approximately $0.02.

Aurora supports all tools that are offered by the Ethereum ecosystem, including MetaMask, Truffle, Remix, etc. Transaction fees are paid in ETH which facilitates the adoption and provides a great UX for those developers who got used to Ethereum’s functionality.

Rainbow Bridge

One more scaling solution that connects NEAR and Aurora with Ethereum is the Rainbow Bridge enabling fast, secure and cheap transfers of ERC-20 tokens. Its core protocol is fully compatible with stablecoins, wrapped assets, DEX, lending and service company tokens as well as with NFTs.

As an Aurora’s product that is available to everyone, the Rainbow Bridge does not require any special permission to deploy, maintain or use. You just need to have the Ethereum Faucet and MetaMask Wallet for Ethereum and Aurora. As for NEAR, you can use the official NEAR Wallet or MyNearWallet.

Transfers between NEAR and Aurora happen as a single transaction and are executed within seconds with costs not exceeding a few cents. Transfers from Ethereum are processed in the same way but may take up to 10 minutes. However, sending funds back to Ethereum involves two transactions and may need approximately 16 hours, while its cost depends on gas prices and is always unpredictable.

Octopus Network

The Octopus Network is an interoperable multichain network for launching and running Web3 application-specific blockchains also known as appchains. At the heart of the platform there is the Octopus Relay represented by a set of smart contracts building on NEAR, which was selected as a mainchain of the whole network when NEAR and Octopus Network partnered in 2021.

The Octopus Relay supports interoperability between appchains and NEAR so that they can also become interoperable with blockchains outside the Octopus Network via bridges on NEAR (like Ethereum via the Rainbow Bridge), or with an out-of-box IBC pallet maintaining connection with any IBC-enabled blockchains, including Cosmos and Polkadot.

By operating as a free market where appchains are able to lease the level of security they need in their native tokens at market price from $OCT holders. Absolutely any project can apply to become an appchain, however, they need to complete several steps which are: registration, audit, voting, and booting.

Ecosystem

Along with Aurora and the Octopus Network, NEAR Protocol creates an iron triangle to empower even more decentralized applications with ecosystem sustainability possibilities. Being a relatively young blockchain with so much to offer to the industry, NEAR Protocol has already become home to over 800 projects, thus creating many viable use cases, including but not limited to wallets, DeFi platforms, NFT marketplaces, metaverses, dev tools, stablecoins, oracles, DAOs, etc.

Now, let’s have a look at the most prominent projects that form the NEAR ecosystem.

Attarius Network

Attarius Network is the first ever one-stop-shop NFT ecosystem for the gaming industry which aims at facilitating the creation, integration and management of Web3 games and game assets. The team is working on a developer toolkit to add value to various gaming projects and bring new economic features for making money to gamers and supporters. Attarius Network partnered with the Octopus Network to become an appchain candidate as well as brought GameFi to Aurora by integrating in-house GameAPI to it.

Aurigami

As Aurora’s native decentralized non-custodial money market, Aurigami allows for turning Aurora-based assets into interest-bearing auTokens so that they can be utilized more efficiently and strategically. At the same time, the platform enables leveraging through collateralized borrowing with an opportunity to deploy borrowed funds elsewhere for getting additional yield. Thus, by unlocking some extra liquidity and flexibility of assets, Aurigami contributes significantly to the DeFi prosperity.

Flux

Flux Protocol represents the trustless data layer for Web3. Operating as the cross-chain, open-source and permissionless oracle, it provides smart contracts with access to economically secure data feeds and lets developers design solutions for data provision and retrieval, for example, create markets based on assets, commodities, or real-world events. Shortly after Flux was rolled out on NEAR, it partnered with Aurora to help bootstrap the ecosystem’s growth of DeFi.

Math Wallet

Being the world’s first insured multi-chain and multi-platform (available for desktop, Android and iOS) wallet designed for Web3, Math Wallet supports cross-chain token bridges and multi-chain dApp store as well as sending, storage and exchange of over 140 popular assets: NEAR, AURORA, all BTC, ETH/ERC20, NEO/NEP5, EOS, TRON, ONT/ONG, ENU/Telos/EOSC/BOS, Binance Chain, and Cosmos/IRIS tokens.

MyNearWallet

MyNearWallet is an open-source, non-custodial web-based wallet with full transparency for the whole NEAR community. Taking over the original NEAR Wallet codebase, it provides users with a better and more secure way to store, buy, send, and stake NEAR assets. In addition, it supports wNEAR (a wrapped version of NEAR token deployed on Aurora which makes it compatible with non-native blockchains like Ethereum) swaps, as well as decentralized apps and non-fungible tokens.

Muse Network

With blockchain and NFTs increasingly integrating to the music industry, credible and low-cost copyright solutions are required. Muse Network is a high-performance music public chain actively building out on Octopus Network that enables all participants to work together on creation, discovery and sharing of music. Copyright authentication process is significantly simplified by the process of generating unique, permanent and non-tamperable data on blockchain through hashing and time stamping. Community incentivized rewards that can be received through sharing, tipping and engagement of content make it possible for artists to spread and trade their music pieces.

NEAR Explorer and NEAR Wallet

These are two in-house solutions designed by the NEAR Protocol team. NEAR Explorer serves as an online blockchain browser which displays the contents of individual NEAR blocks and transactions as well as the transaction histories and balances of addresses. NEAR Wallet is an in-browser web-based wallet for operating with NEAR accounts, which stores account keys in open text using the localStorage on the user's machine.

NearPay

NearPay is a crypto finance protocol that facilitates user experience with managing, spending and exchanging cryptocurrencies. NearPay’s suite of products includes NearPay Wallet and NearPay Card, which provide convenient on-ramp and off-ramp solutions. Additionally, NearPay provides a widget that allows users to buy NEAR, AURORA, and other cryptocurrencies.

And with NearPay Prepaid Visa Card, day-to-day payments can be made in crypto anywhere Visa is accepted.

Ref Finance

One more platform running on NEAR that benefits from NEAR’s low fees, 1-2 second finality, and WebAssembly-based runtime is Ref Finance. As a community-led and multi-purpose DeFi project, it provides users with atomic transactions, multiple pools in one smart contract, and customizable pool fee. Ref Finance also enables trading, staking and stake farming as well as taking part in platform’s governance and votes for holders of its native REF token.

Roketo

Roketo is a crypto streaming solution built on NEAR that offers full transparency for both instant and continuous payments. It serves as a vesting and airdrop solution and makes setting up and handling payrolls a breeze, all whilst providing full control and the utmost safety. Roketo supports NEAR, OCT, REF, and other NEP-141 tokens that take a minimum amount of time to proceed (typically less than one minute).

Trisolaris

Trisolaris is an Aurora-powered decentralized exchange considered to be the most popular solution for trading in terms of total value locked (TLV) and volume built on NEAR’s Aurora EVM. It allows users to swap, pool, and farm, and earn fair revenue and boasts low-fee, lightning-fast transactions. Trisolaris is backed up by $TRI, the platform’s native token that helps TRI-based farm users earn higher yields. Trading experience on Trisolaris is similar to native Ethereum for a fraction of the cost.

That’s just part of exciting projects that unlock the limitless potential of NEAR Protocol. You can find the full list of the NEAR ecosystem’s project on AwesomeNEAR that was made by NEARFans, a NEAR-based DAO that consists of founders, investors, artists, designers, developers, and product managers who have been navigating the crypto waters since 2012.

NEARCON

Today, the NEAR community counts over 500 000 enthusiasts who intend to accelerate the adoption of Web3. For the purpose of gathering together the best and the brightest minds supporting the prosperity of NEAR, the massive event called NEARCON was created and has already taken place twice. The first conference was held in October 2021 as a grand celebration of the Near mainnet first anniversary while the second one rocked Lisbon this September.

NEARCON Beta became a great mix of the conference itself, festival and an intensive 48 hour in-person hackathon, showcasing more than 700 projects being built on NEAR that were launched in less than a year. The event managed to unite 2,000+ attendees and 300+ developers who are currently contributing to the protocol enhancement and are eager to start building on NEAR.

Over 180 keynote speakers delivered 128 sessions across 4 stages with Illia Polosukhin, Co-Founder NEAR Protocol, Marieke Flament, CEO NEAR Foundation, and Alex Shevchenko, CEO Aurora Labs, topping the 2022 lineup of featured experts.

Final Thoughts

The NEAR’s ever-growing ecosystem is a vivid example of how the rate of Web3 adoption increases. As the DeFi sector develops and matures, more businesses and individuals start exploring the technology behind it, creating a huge room for different use cases to emerge.

By educating people and making the transition between Web2 and Web3 as smooth as possible, NEAR has all chances to become a game-changing project and mitigate all existing drawbacks like scalability and cross-chain operability that prevent the mass adoption on a global scale.

The demand for the democratic and privacy-oriented internet is evident but only time will tell whether full decentralization is really achievable.

article_title: How Binance’s Investment in Ankr Paid Off in Millions - CoinCodex
text:
Back in August, Binance Labs announced an investment into Ankr. Ankr, a well-known provider of Web 3 infrastructure, has long-standing partnerships with systems like Polygon, AAVE, Avalanche, SushiSwap and more, making their alliance with Binance another large name in their field.

Binance Labs' investment went into increasing the functionality of Ankr’s RPC (Remote Procedure Call) service, further helping to build the offering of what Ankr’s Web 3 systems can offer to developers.

A few months after this investment, Ankr was one of the leading preventers of millions of dollars being siphoned off the platform. In this article, we’ll break down Binance’s investment into Ankr, demonstrating why this deal came about, and how it paid off so remarkably for Binance Labs.

Let’s get right into it.

What is Ankr?

Founded back in 2017, Ankr has built up its network into a primary Web 3 system. Ankr is one of the fastest Web 3 infrastructures in the world, providing developers with the perfect system to launch their DApp creations on.

Currently, Ankr processes over 7.2 billion API requests on a daily basis, covering the daily uses of over 39,000 developers. As an international community with a remote workforce, Ankr’s 24/7 availability has made it the go-to for many blockchain companies. Currently, there are over 18 supported networks within Ankr, helping developers to integrate into whichever ecosystem they see fit.

As a decentralized and chain-neutral system, Ankr is helping the world to build a multi-chain future.

Why Did Binance Partner with Ankr?

Although this investment was strictly under wraps until its announcement, it’s not a particularly surprising venture for Binance Labs. Alongside Ankr’s popularity within the Web 3 community, it has actually already had a great deal of interaction with Binance.

Ankr had already contributed to the BNB Liquid Staking and BNB Chain system, their open-source contributions becoming a primary part of the BNB Chain infrastructure. Beyond in-ecosystem development, Ankr has also upgraded the Archive and Erigon Nodes, helping to push the utility of the Binance system.

The latter Erigon system upgrades focused on reducing BNB Chain’s requirements for storage, helping to create a much more efficient system. Equally, its integration into the system allowed the RPC process to streamline its performance, as well as helping to improve the synchronization process.

In short, Ankr is no stranger to BNB Chain. Considering their current upward trend in terms of how often they’re being integrated into blockchain systems, and their prior work with Binance, it was only a matter of time.

Ankr’s main position within this partnership is to help BNB Chain scale their operations further, increasing the total number of transactions that can be handled in a day. With this increase, there’s room to bring more customers onto the platform, as well as boost the utility of the BNB token itself.

How Ankr Helped BNB Chain Handle Its $100 Million Hack Exploit

A little over two months after Binance Lab’s investment into Ankr, their decision paid off incredibly. In early October, BNB Chain experienced an exploit, with hackers making off with over $100M of stolen capital that they minted on one of the system’s main bridges. While $100 million may seem like a hefty sum, this pales in comparison to the total amount that they were attempting to steal - nearly $560M of BNB.

The main reason that the hackers were thwarted so early into their mint and liquidate strategy was because BNB Chain’s validators noticed a discrepancy in the activity on the bridge. By freezing the ecosystem, these validators were able to then help BNB Chain to stop the majority of the newly-minted funds from leaving the platform.

Out of these validators, Ankr was among the first to respond, quickly notifying the other validators to spring into action. Alongside this rapid response leading to less money leaking from the platform, Ankr’s RPC was also fundamental in getting BNB Chain back up and running.

After freezing, BNB Chain went through a Hard Fork to prevent any further exploits from occurring. While other validators took time to adjust to this large-scale change, Ankr’s RPC stayed pegged to the BNB Chain, allowing their systems to get back up and running instantly.

Instead of further delaying the reactivation of DApps on the platform, the availability of Ankr’s RPC service allowed this system to continue on as normal, mirroring the ecosystem’s recovery.

Not only did their response help to prevent more money from being stolen from the platform, but the technology that Binance Labs had invested in a few months prior led to an incredible response speed after the Hard Fork.

Final Thoughts

In short, the investment that Binance Labs made into Ankr paid off in as little as two months. By focusing on their RPC infrastructure, Binance was able to increase the functionality of its platform. Especially in the aforementioned crisis, the rapid response that Ankr demonstrated allowed for the worst of the event to be avoided.

Ankr’s actions further show why this Web 3 infrastructure provider has gained such a positive image within the blockchain community. Alongside boosting utility, its investment in security and responsiveness has made it one of the leading mechanisms in response to a crisis event.

Binance Labs certainly lucked out with this partnership.

article_title: How to stake Fantom (FTM)? - Cointelegraph
text:
Fantom (FTM) is known for its speed and inexpensive layer-1 blockchain. Like other blockchains (for example, Solana (SOL) and Avalanche (AVAX)) that scale better than their counterpart, it has been dubbed an “Ethereum killer.” After raising $40 million in funds, Fantom launched its mainnet in December 2019. Since then, it has grown to become one of the most popular blockchains, sitting in the top 10 blockchains by total value locked (TVL) with $1.3 billion in TVL.

Fantom’s high-throughput blockchain is an open-source smart contract platform. It is scalable and EVM-compatible, meaning you can deploy and run your Ethereum decentralized applications (DApps) on Fantom. Its structure enables the support for its decentralized finance (DeFi), other than managing digital assets and DApps.

The Fantom consensus mechanism is an adapted version of proof-of-stake, and it’s called Lachesis. It’s been designed to provide high-speed transactions, low fees and almost instant finality due to the aBFT algorithm. aBFT can scale to many nodes worldwide in a permissionless, open-source environment, offering a good level of decentralization.

The Fantom blockchain is powered by its native FTM token, and if you believe in the project and want to grow your FTM stack, you can consider staking Fantom to earn passive income.

What is Fantom staking?

Staking is making a blockchain more secure by locking up an investor’s digital assets for a certain amount of time. This security is provided by validators who validate transactions with their staked tokens, which becomes an economic incentive for them to behave according to the protocol’s rules.

By staking FTM, investors actively participate in securing its network while earning passive income, i.e., FTM rewards. Staking means that tokens will have to be locked up for some time; however, they will still be sitting in the owners’ wallets, only they can access and unlock their funds anytime.

How to stake FTM

The minimum stake amount to run a validator is 500,000 FTM to prevent Sybil attacks on its consensus mechanism. Sybil attacks are malicious attacks that involve falsifying multiple identities to gain an undue advantage within a network. As the validator’s required amount is relatively high, it becomes easier to delegate FTM to a validator.

A few Fantom staking strategies can be used:

Fluid staking: Investors can lock up their FTM token from two weeks to 365 days for better returns. The reward varies according to the length of the staking period; the longer FTMs are staked, the higher the reward rate. Liquid staking: Investors can mint sFTM for improved ROI when liquid staking. They can also stake farmed tokens, participate in liquidity mining, farm LP rewards and more. Custodial staking: Investors can take FTM on a centralized exchange (CEX) like Binance or Coinbase. The staking reward is 1%.

To stake on Fantom, users can follow these simple steps:

Have a minimum of 1 FTM to stake; Go to the Fantom staking page and click Stake your FTM;

You can log in with a compatible wallet, like MetaMask. You can open the wallet from your computer or your mobile device. You can create a new wallet or access an existing one using a mnemonic or seed phrase. Deposit your FTM by transferring them from an exchange or another wallet to your Fantom Opera wallet address. Click on “Staking.” Add a delegation by choosing a validator and an amount. Select your lock-up period and confirm.

There are a few options when it comes to optimal Fantom wallets. The Fantom Opera network is a second-layer and EVM-compatible blockchain, meaning that you can use any wallet that works for Ethereum, such as MetaMask, the Coinbase Wallet or a cold wallet like Ledger.

After creating an account on Fantom, you can also download your Fantom wallet (fwallet) by clicking on the “Create Wallet” button:

Where to stake FTM?

Other than its native blockchain network, Fantom can be staked across many platforms, including decentralized exchanges (DEX) and custodial blockchains. Here we’ll look at the places to stake Fantom so you can decide which is the most suitable.

How to stake Fantom on Ledger

Staking through a hardware wallet like Ledger works through a smart contract interaction, like other transactions. It’s sufficient to stake from the Fantom fWallet by signing Fantom FTM Ledger Nano S application. Then, use the “Stake” menu item on your account.

How to stake Fantom on Coinbase

In September 2021, Fantom announced support for the Fantom network on the Coinbase Wallet. Coinbase Wallet users can access and use the Fantom network and engage with Fantom DApps. Users can connect their Coinbase Wallet account to their Fantom fWallet and conduct activities such as stake FTM and earn rewards.

How to stake Fantom on Binance

To stake FTM on Binance, you have to deposit a convenient amount on the exchange, then go to Binance Earn and pick the suitable product for you; usually, it’s a locked up period of 30, 60, or 120 days. You can choose a more extended staking period for higher returns up to 14%.

How to stake Fantom on Kucoin

Similarly to Binance, you must deposit your FTM token on Kucoin and go to Kucoin Earn. Then click “Subscribe” to pick the product that suits you better, based on rewards and the time you want to lock your assets.

Is it safe to stake FTM?

It is safe to stake FTM because the validator node cannot access your staked tokens; make sure not to lose your mnemonic phrase or private key. However, like in other proof-of-stake blockchains, you risk losing a fraction of your stake if the validator is not reputable and misbehaves. It’s safer to select reputable Fantom validators who always have active communities, websites and Twitter accounts.

How to stake other tokens on Fantom

Fantom provides a flexible and dynamic ecosystem enabling the staking of several DeFi tokens to earn passive income on your investment. To use any of the following systems to stake their native tokens, you need a MetaMask or any other wallet mentioned above connected to the Fantom Opera network. In this case, Fantom staking acts like a CEX, such as Binance, becoming a marketplace where non-native cryptocurrencies are traded.

Here are some of the most popular tokens that are based and can be staked on Fantom:

Spookyswap is the biggest DEX on Fantom, with $777 million TVL and BOO being its native token, which can be bonded with FTM for maximum liquidity and to yield farm. To stake BOO, buy the tokens in an exchange or swap them in Spookyswap; connect your wallet to Fantom Opera to view your positions and start earning.

BeethovenX is a community-driven DEX, an automated market maker (AMM) and a DeFi powerhouse. Governed by BEETS native token and living on the Fantom Opera and Optimism chain, it yields an APR of 31%. To stake Beets, after depositing some FTM, connect your wallet to Fantom Opera and follow the procedure to choose a validator and the locking time.

QiDao is an autonomous and community-governed protocol that sits on Fantom and allows you to borrow stablecoins with zero interest against your crypto assets used as collateral. Loans are paid and repaid in miTokens (stablecoin soft pegged to the USD).

Scream is another decentralized lending protocol powered by Fantom, similar to platforms like Compound (COMP) and Aave (AAVE). Users who stake SCREAM tokens can earn around 58% APR, while for liquidity providers, the rewards can be as high as 82% APR.

How to run a Fantom node

Validators run full nodes and are a crucial part of the Fantom network. By running a full node, validators participate in the consensus to boost security and generate new blocks. There are some technical requirements and skills to be considered to run a Fantom full node, and it might be more suitable for a techie operator.

Following are the requirements necessary to run a Fantom full node:

Minimum requirement: 500,000 FTM

Maximum validator size: 15x the self-stake amount

Minimum hardware requirements: AWS EC2 m5.xlarge with four vCPUs (3.1 GHz) and at least 4.5 TB of Amazon EBS General Purpose SSD (gp2) storage (or equivalent).

Rewards: currently ~13% APY (Normal APY on self-stake + 15% of delegators' rewards). APY varies based on staked %. For up-to-date APY, check the Fantom Foundation website.

A step-by-step guide to running a full-node

Users can run a node on their hardware or use a cloud provider. One of the big cloud providers, e.g., Amazon AWS, is recommended. They can set up a non-root user. Install the required building tools; install Go and then Opera. Register their Fantom validator node on-chain. To do this, users need to create a validator wallet that becomes the validator’s identity in the network, required to authenticate, sign messages, etc. Run their own node. To do this, they need to restart their node in validator mode, then close the Opera window by typing “exit.” Then they need to head back to the window where they started their node with the following command:

(validator)$ nohup ./opera --genesis $NETWORK --nousb --validator.id ID --validator.pubkey 0xPubkey --validator.password /path/to/password &

Users can refer to Fantom’s instructions for full specifications and details on how to run a validator node.

How much money can you make staking Fantom?

You can earn 5.01% if you choose the minimum lock-up period (14 days) and the minimum amount. The maximum APY is currently 15.31% for the maximum lock-up period of 365 days.

The FTM staking rewards calculator will estimate how much can be earned by staking Fantom.

FTM and most crypto tokens have dropped by over 90% during the 2022 bear market; therefore, staking will grow the number of your tokens but not necessarily the overall value. It’s also worth considering that staking and locking your tokens up may make your funds illiquid and exiting a position difficult.

Purchase a licence for this article. Powered by SharpShark.

article_title: P2E Gaming Project Tamadoge Goes Live on OKX Following $19M Presale, Netting +180% ROI for Early TAMA Investors - CoinCodex
text:
Key takeaways:

TAMA, the native token of the popular metaverse project Tamadoge, has been listed on OKX

Tamadoge raised $19 million during a presale that saw inventors purchase TAMA tokens at a gradually increasing price between $0.010 and $0.030

Early TAMA presale investors are up +180% on their crypto investment

Early Tamadoge presale investors are up more than 180% on their TAMA investment

After a two-month-long presale campaign that raised over $19 million for Tamadoge, a Play-to-Earn (P2E) blockchain gaming metaverse, the project’s native TAMA token is now available to global investors following the listing on the OKX crypto exchange.

At 11 am UTC earlier today, TAMA/USDT spot trading pair went live on OKX, with TAMA withdrawals following suit tomorrow at 11:00 am UTC. The Tamadoge team shared the news to its “Tamadoge Army” and the broader crypto community via Twitter.

Buy/Sell TAMA on OKX

Following the initial launch on OKX, the TAMA token will be made available to OKX decentralized exchange (DEX) users later today at 5 pm UTC.

Tamadoge consists of several distinctive products and services, including the Tamaverse (the project’s own metaverse world), Tamadoge Pets (NFT-powered creatures at the heart of the Tamadoge project), and last but not least, the Tamadoge token (the project’s native utility token).

During the multi-stage presale period that started on July 26 and lasted two months, investors were able to obtain TAMA at a price of $0.10 to $0.30 per token, depending on how early they invested. In total, 19 million USDT was raised for the project.

After the TAMA/USDT pairing was enabled roughly an hour ago, the price of TAMA first dropped from above $0.030 to $0.020, but quickly rebounded to hit $0.028 at press time. At its current price, the earliest TAMA presale participants are up more than +180% on their investment.

In addition to the OKX listing, presale investors are now able to claim their TAMA tokens on the project’s homepage.

Presale investors can claim their TAMA via the Tamadoge website. Image source: Tamadoge

According to the Tamadoge roadmap, Tamadoge NFT Petstore is slated to open in the final quarter of 2022, while Tamadoge P2E Arcade games and Tamadoge AR app supporting NFT creatures are slated to go live in the second half of 2023.

article_title: Binance P2P Is Turning 3—My Experiences with P2P Crypto Trading - CoinCodex
text:
As the world's leading cryptocurrency exchange, Binance marks its 3rd year of joining the P2P game. I’ll be sharing my experience with the Binance P2P platform and the reason why I choose it over other peer-to-peer crypto trading platforms.

If you're a beginner and yet to get acquainted with the P2P method of trading digital assets, this experience might seem odd to you. Hence, let's first delve a little into what P2P trading is all about and how it differs from the more common approach of trading crypto through orderbooks on an exchange.

Peer-to-peer trading is the oldest form of crypto trading, and it has been around practically ever since Bitcoin was invented. It is a trading approach in which a buyer and seller personally agree to a deal and then trade their assets directly with each other.

While trading through orderbooks is highly efficient, it’s not suitable for everyone. This is because cryptocurrency exchanges usually only support a limited number of funding options. In peer-to-peer trading, on the other hand, you can use a wide range of payment methods to buy and sell cryptocurrencies, so long as the person you’re trading with is fine with your payment method of choice.

Without further ado, let’s take a look at why Binance P2P is my go-to platform for my peer-to-peer cryptocurrency trading.

Trade crypto on Binance P2P

Why do I use Binance P2P?

I started using the Binance P2P platform after the monetary authorities in my country placed a strict ban on the use of bank accounts that are directly connected with cryptocurrency exchanges.

As a crypto trader who didn’'t want to take on the risks associated with transacting in the open market, I had a lot to worry about. The thought of my crypto possibly falling into the hands of fraudsters was very discouraging.

Fortunately, my worries faded after my first encounter with Binance P2P 2 years ago. Binance P2P was a game changer for me considering the situation in my country at the time. The platform gave me the opportunity to trade my crypto assets while connecting directly with traders from different parts of the world without the fear of losing my funds to fraudsters. This opportunity also comes with the added benefit of being able to comfortably choose a payment method that I am most comfortable with out of the hundreds featured on the platform.

Due to its friendly user interface, Binance P2P can be used by expert crypto traders and beginners alike. If you’re interested, you can get started now by getting an account and experiencing Binance P2P for yourself.

As for the cryptocurrencies that are supported by Binance P2P, BNB, BTC, ETH and USDT are just a few examples.

Why choose Binance P2P?

Although there are a lot of P2P platforms in the crypto market today, Binance P2P offers probably the best peer-to-peer trading experience among all of them. Here are some of the platform’s most unique and useful features which make it stand out above the rest.

Binance P2P enhances security through escrow

Relating back to my experience with Binance P2P, the platform allows you to trade your assets without having to be afraid of thieves or scammers. Basically, Binance P2P adopts a holding mechanism for assets that have been placed on order. The platform uses escrow to pin down the assets as a form of protection. The assets are then released to the deserving party after the necessary confirmations have been made. This way, bad actors can’t claim the assets without completing their part of the transaction.

Swift transactions and zero fees

Here's another feature to love about Binance P2P. The platform offers users easy and fast transactions with no extra cost. Binance P2P users save more money while executing transactions as they do not need to bother paying for fees.

Global support

Binance P2P currently offers its services to over 14 million traders from all around the globe. This covers over 252 regions and countries of the world. This simply means there are thousands of buyers and sellers on the platform waiting to connect with you. As such, there's no difficulty in finding a buyer or seller that is willing to accept the payment method proposed. Furthermore, the platform supports hundreds of fiat currencies and third-party payment solutions.

Promotional offers for celebrating Binance P2P’s 3-year milestone

Since its launch in 2019, the Binance team has been working to improve the efficiency of the Binance P2P platform. To mark the Binance P2P 3rd year of existence, the platform has planned to celebrate this milestone with a bunch of exciting activities coming to the platform soon.

Binance swag and a 43,000 BUSD prize pool

In celebration of Binance P2P turning 3, the platform has also promised its users exclusive Binance swag items following certain criteria. With a prize pool of 43,000 BUSD, users who are able to meet the platform's stated qualifications will have the opportunity to earn significant rewards.

100% Maker Fee Rebate

Binance P2P has promised a 100% maker fee rebate in celebration of its 3 years of existence. This offer is available to users who post advertisements and trade in any local currency on Binance P2P.

However, participants must meet certain criteria's to be deemed eligible for this activity. Participants must first complete P2P trades with at least five unique counterparties during the period of the promo. Next, the participants must ensure they have achieved up to 95% overall order completion rate before the promo elapses. Also, the participants must accumulate a total trading volume of at least $5,000 equivalent (including buys and sells) on Binance P2P during the same period.

According to the platform, participants who are able to make it to the top 50 will be awarded a 100% rebate on maker fees. This is an opportunity to earn up to 200 BUSD in a cashback voucher.

Meanwhile, Binance users must note that only users who trade with the Binance P2P will be considered eligible to participate in any of the promo offers.

How to use Binance P2P?

Here is a step by step guide for users to understand how to use the Binance P2P platform. Note, the platform adopts a very friendly user interface. As such, the processes are easy to follow and understand.

Firstly, interested persons should get a Binance account and complete the Identity Verification process as directed on the platform. A few documents are required to complete the verification process.

After a successful verification process, you now have access to Binance P2P. Hence, you can proceed to setting up the payment method most suitable to you. Binance P2P supports more than 300 payment methods, hence there are various options to choose from.

After completing the aforementioned step, you are now ready to start trading on the Binance P2P platform.

On occasions when you want to sell your crypto assets, you should transfer the assets from your Binance spot wallets to your Binance funding wallets. This way, the assets can be available to sell on Binance P2P.

On occasions when you want to buy crypto assets on P2P, click on ads from buyers displayed on the platform who meet your requirements.

Users who intend to buy crypto assets on Binance P2P have to place an order on a matching ads, pay the seller via the suggested payment method as displayed on the order, and then you have the escrowed assets released into your wallet once the payment is confirmed by the seller.

Users who intend to sell their crypto assets via Binance P2P are required to place an order which immediately causes the assets to be escrowed by the platform. Next, once the platform notifies that payment has been made by the supposed buyer, you should check if you've truly received the payment and confirm the payment immediately. If the payment has been confirmed, you should proceed to releasing the crypto.

Final thoughts—Binance P2P is one of the best options for P2P crypto trading

With Binance P2P celebrating its third anniversary, it is amazing how the platform has managed to attain significant milestones within just a few years operations. Its unique features have made it a go-to platform for every crypto user who desires to connect directly to traders from all parts of the world. If you’re looking to trade crypto P2P, Binance is definitely an option worth considering.

article_title: European Council Passes MiCA Crypto Regulation – A Turning ... - Cryptonews
text:
European Council Passes MiCA Crypto Regulation – A Turning Point for Crypto Landscape

The European Council on Wednesday passed the new MiCA crypto regulation, which by many is seen as a turning point for Europe’s crypto industry.

The new bill, with the full name Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA), has now been voted through the European Council but still needs to pass an additional vote in the European Parliament next week.

The next step after MiCA has also passed the European Parliament will be to translate the full text into the more than 20 official languages of the EU. The bill includes a 12-18-month adaptation period meant to help companies adjust to the new regulations.

The bill aims to regulate all crypto-related activities, and especially the issuance of cryptocurrencies, that take place within the European Union. Notably, the bill will also bring much more stringent oversight for companies that are defined as so-called crypto-asset service providers (CASPs).

Among the requirements that will be placed on CASPs under the new rules is legal liability for the companies if they lose their clients’ cryptoassets. The rule covers all centralized companies in the crypto space, including wallet providers of ‘hosted’ or custodial wallets, but not so-called ‘unhosted wallets’ otherwise known as crypto wallets where the private keys are controlled by users.

Notably, the new regulations do not include a ban on proof-of-work (PoW) mining, as was originally proposed.

The EU first reached an agreement on MiCA in July this year. Back then, representatives of the crypto industry, such as Rebecca Rettig, a board member at the crypto-friendly bank Silvergate, applauded the effort to “provide clarity in the crypto space” while also noting that there is “more work to be done.”

article_title: SWEAT x Ref Finance: The comprehensive bridging & staking user ... - Medium
text:
SWEAT x Ref Finance: The comprehensive bridging & staking user guide Ref Finance · Follow 6 min read · Sep 30, 2022 -- 1 Listen Share

Sweat Economy, 2022 number 1 downloaded health and fitness app with more than 120 Million users, just successfully launched its TGE event on Near & Ethereum on Sept 13th. The SWEAT Token was then listed on Ref finance immediately, followed by a SWEAT-NEAR farm on Sep 14 with triple tokens rewards.

If you are a SWEAT holder, and your tokens are still on a CEX or Ethereum, or they’re still in your SWEAT app, but you want to farm with them on Ref Finance, this user guide is perfect for you.

What’s required?

In order to join this farm, you will need 2 tokens, which are obviously NEAR and SWEAT, and a NEAR wallet.

NEAR Wallet

If you don’t have a NEAR Wallet yet, you can create one in under 5 minutes with a non-custodial wallet such as MyNearWallet, Sender, or you can use a Ledger.

The NEAR Token

You can buy NEAR on most of the big exchanges such as Binance, Coinbase, Kraken etc. or you can buy via some fiat off-ramp solutions such as NEAR Pay, Moon pay, or Transak, which have been directly integrated into the Ref finance UI.

The SWEAT Token

If you are a native Near user, you can buy SWEAT directly on Ref finance; But if you’re not a native Near user, and your SWEAT tokens are on a CEX or Ethereum or they’re still in your SWEAT app, there are ways to bring them to the NEAR blockchain.

How to get SWEAT from CEXs to Near

Since the TGE, SWEAT has been listed on numerous exchanges such as OKX, Bitfinex, FTX, Kucoin, Bybit, Huobi and Gate, which makes access to it super easy.

However, not every exchange supports withdrawals to the NEAR network. As we understand, so far OKX, Kucoin, Bybit, and Huobi are the exchanges that allow users to withdraw their SWEAT to NEAR.

This time, we are going to use Bybit as an example.

After you’ve got your SWEAT tokens ready, go to your Spot Wallet, and here you can see the option to Withdraw.

On the pop-up window:

Choose your Chain Type as NEAR( or NEP-141) Fill in your Wallet Address that ends with .near Enter the amount you want to withdraw (Notice that there will be a withdrawal fee, the amount depends on the exchange)

Hit Submit after you’ve confirmed everything.

Finish with some Verification steps and it’s done!

How to get SWEAT from Ethereum to Near

If you are a participant of SWEAT IDO on MakerDAO or you bought your SWEAT on Ethereum, check out the tutorial below.

You can bridge SWEAT from Ethereum to NEAR via Wormhole, aka Portal Bridge.

First, go to https://www.portalbridge.com/#/transfer

Choose the route Ethereum > NEAR, then connect your Ethereum wallet.

Next, choose the token we’re about to bridge, which in this case will be SWEAT.

Enter the amount you want to bridge, then hit Next

Connect your NEAR Wallet in the next step, and continue by hitting Next.

You will need to Approve Portal Bridge to transfer your tokens in the next step, you can choose to allow the bridge to spend infinitely so you don’t have to approve next time, or you can choose to approve only the amount you are about to send.

After the Approval step, it’s time to transfer the tokens. Simple hit the Transfer button, confirm the transaction in your wallet and you’re good to go.

Bridging can take quite some time, ideally around 10–15 minutes.

The final step is Redeeming the tokens, just need to hit Redeem and you are done! Easy right?

How to get SWEAT from The Sweat Wallet to Near

Sweat wallet is the app you need to download in order to manage the tokens you’ve collected from walking in the main app. If you haven’t downloaded it yet, find it here.

Hit the Transfer button, and choose Send.

Enter your NEAR address, and hit Continue.

Fill in the amount you want to transfer, and hit Continue.

Slide the glider, once you’ve confirmed everything.

And done, no sweat! :)

How to farm with SWEAT on Ref finance

Head to https://app.ref.finance/, go to the Farm page, and look for the SWEAT <> NEAR farm.

In order to farm, you will first need to add liquidity to the pool to receive the LP tokens.

Here you will need both SWEAT and NEAR at a specific rate depending on the corresponding value of 2 tokens at the time you provide liquidity.

Liquidity farming is not without risks, it is strongly recommended that you should do your own research before making any decision. Ref finance has a Risk section that we recommend you give a look.

After you’ve added the liquidity, go back to the previous farm page and proceed to Stake the LP tokens, or Share

Enter any amount you like, and hit Stake.

Approve the transaction in your wallet and you are done!

article_title: Is ApeCoin the Next Cryptocurrency to Explode On APE Staking ... - Cryptonews
text:
Is ApeCoin the Next Cryptocurrency to Explode On APE Staking Launch

ApeCoin appears set to pump in the coming days and weeks ahead of staking for APE going live.

The coin has made steady gains in the last seven days, up 15% on the week and 7% in the last 24 hours, with more growth expected after Horizen Labs announced they would hold a Twitter Spaces on the subject on September 22.

It remains unclear when exactly staking will go live, with some holders expressing annoyance and disappointment on social media that it hasn't happened yet.

However, the general sentiment on APE is now bullish and the market could see more growth both pre- and post-staking going live, with investors rushing to buy up the coin and then take it off the market.

What is ApeCoin and the Bored Ape Yacht Club?

The Bored Ape Yacht Club (often referred to as BAYC) is one of the premier NFT collections in crypto.

Despite billions being drained from the NFT market and many collections in the red, the cheapest BAYC is still on sale for 72 ETH (approx. $125,000) and during the NFT bull run last summer, multiple Bored Apes sold for tens of millions of dollars.

The collection has a number of celebrity backers, with Eminem, Snoop Dogg, Madonna, Jimmy Fallon and many others.

The BAYC universe also includes other collections - the Mutant Ape Yacht Club and Bored Ape Kennel Club - which are secondary collections and go for significantly less but are still highly sought after.

ApeCoin is an ERC20 token that acts as that the governance token within the APE Ecosystem and the ApeCoin Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO), it is a community-driven initiative allowing holders to vote on ideas, projects and other tasks within the ecosystem.

It also allows holders exclusive access to other things such as merchandise, events, premium games and services and we named it among our top 10 best new cryptos to buy.

APE reached an all-time high of $25 in May and although it's price has dropped significantly, it has remained in the top 40 coins by market cap based on the desirability of the Bored Ape ecosystem and the strength of the community, despite its general lack of utility compared to some projects.

What is APE Staking?

The ApeCoin DAO has released full details on what staking will entail.

But in summary, ApeCoin will be distributed to all Bored Ape and Mutant Ape holders that stake their NFTs plus APE coin. It offers great incentive for holders of the NFT to buy more APE with the sole intention of staking it and the more that do the higher the rewards will be.

However, for holders to generate max returns they have to hold a set amount of APE (10,094 for BAYC and 2,042 for MAYC) and many holders do not earn close to that.

Twitter user Ouroboros Capital has broken down APE staking, NFT holder wallets and the potential amount BAYC and MAYC holders could earn and concluded that APE will become a must buy for them soon.

Not only will that see increased demand but once staking goes lives, the supply of the coin is set to be sucked out of the market.

One alternative coin with similar growth potential in the coming weeks is Tamadoge.

The project is currently enjoying an extremely successful presale and has raised almost $15 million in just over a month, with around just 15% of the presale allocation remaining.

article_title: Dubai's Future Blockchain Summit to Create Global Business Opportunities for Crypto, Metaverse Innovators - Yahoo Finance
text:
● The fifth edition of the Summit will unveil the potential of immersive metaverse applications, exploring pioneering use-cases

● Crypto, DeFi & Virtual Asset Forum will re-evaluate and navigate the future of alternative investments

Dubai, United Arab Emirates--(Newsfile Corp. - September 22, 2022) - The Future Blockchain Summit, the MENA region's longest running exhibition and conference connecting key stakeholders across Blockchain, crypto, and Web 3.0 will return to Dubai World Trade Centre (DWTC) from 10th-13th October 2022.





Dubai’s Future Blockchain Summit

An integral part of GITEX Global 2022, the world's biggest tech and startup event of the year which will feature over 4,500 tech and digital companies from 170 countries, the four-day event will explore topics including the metaverse, Blockchain for enterprise and the future of digital assets.

The Summit comes at an opportune time for the Middle East region's development in Blockchain and cryptocurrency - the UAE has positioned itself as a global futuristic innovations' hub, emphasised with the recent launch of the Dubai Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority and Dubai Metaverse Strategy, showing the commitment of its government to the implementation and advancement of cutting-edge solutions to the digital economy.

The Summit is set to provide a major international meeting point for the Blockchain and crypto communities, welcoming more than 600 investors, offering Blockchain, cryptocurrency and metaverse innovators an unrivalled opportunity to accelerate their growth. Day four of the Summit will play host to the North Star Dubai Supernova Challenge, the biggest pitch competition in the Middle East, Africa and South Asia, offering startups the opportunity to pitch to an audience of global investors and earn potentially transformative capital.

Leading cryptocurrency exchanges and market makers including OKX, Coinstore, KuCoin, the Hong Kong Digital Assets Exchange, Elliptic, Chainalysis, Coinfirm and Sun Zu Labs will exhibit at the Summit.

Story continues

Blockchain protocol specialists Consensys, EOS Network Foundation, Ultron Foundation will also be exhibiting, while there will also be a comprehensive focus on the Metaverse, NFT and gaming with innovators including Sensorium, METAP Japan and Ghost Ivy set to be at the show.

International experts speaking at the Summit include Aleksandr Bornyakov, Deputy Minister of Digital Transformation, Ukraine; OG Arabian Prince, Founder, iNov8 Next Open Labs, Founding Member of Legendary Rap Group N.W.A; Lennix Lai, Director, OKX; Scott Page, CEO, Think:EXP, Technologist & Saxophone player for Pink Floyd; Farhad Shagulyamov, CEO, VELAS and many more.

The Future Blockchain Summit 2022 will host an engaging line up of over 100 international speakers comprising business and government leaders who will discuss the most pressing challenges and opportunities in the global Blockchain ecosystem. The Global Leaders Exchange, Crypto, DeFi & Virtual Asset Forum, and Metafest will provide visitors with essential insights and offer a glimpse of the emerging future of the Web.

Visit the event website for more information on the Future Blockchain Summit, as well as registration details.

About Dubai World Trade Centre:

With a vision to make Dubai the world's leading destination for all major exhibitions, conferences and events, DWTC has evolved from being the regional forerunner of the fast-growing MICE industry into a multi-dimensional business catalyst, focusing on Venues, Events and Real Estate Management. Complementary to the primary service offerings are a range of value-added services from media/advertising, engineering and technical consultation and wedding planning, security services and an award-winning hospitality portfolio. To know more about the Dubai World Trade Centre, kindly visit their website.

For more information, please contact:

Jensen Matthews PR, via: loredana@jensenmatthews.com

Email Id: steven.besse@dwtc.com

Company Website: https://futureblockchainsummit.com/
