article_title: Binance Simple Earn—A Convenient Way to Grow Your Crypto Holdings - CoinCodex
text:
The ability to earn interest on cryptocurrency holdings is one of the most attractive propositions for crypto investors. After all, many crypto investors prefer to HODL their coins instead of trading them actively.

Products such as Binance’s Simple Earn allow holders to grow their cryptocurrency stack without having to trade in the highly unpredictable cryptocurrency markets. By combining their products for savings and staking, Binance now provides a single convenient platform for users that want to earn interest on their crypto.

As one would expect from Binance, the Simple Earn platform allows users to earn interest on a whole host of different cryptocurrencies. There’s support for large market cap coins like Bitcoin and Ethereum, mid-cap cryptocurrencies like Chainlink and Stellar, as well as stablecoins like Binance USD and Tether.

As the name implies, Binance Simple Earn is a simple way of earning cryptocurrency. You simply deposit your crypto into one of the products, and accumulate rewards on a daily basis. While the returns are not exactly earth-shattering, Simple Earn is a great way to passively grow your crypto holdings without taking on major risks.

Earn with your crypto on Binance Simple Earn

The two main types of products you can find on Binance Simple Earn are flexible and locked products. Here’s how they work.

Flexible products

Flexible products provide interest on cryptocurrency deposits, with users being able to redeem (withdraw) their coins at any time. Rewards accumulate on a daily basis, but you will only be able to access your rewards after redeeming your funds. There are two ways to redeem funds from a flexible product on Binance Simple Earn.

Fast redemption (prioritize speed): A fast redemption will make your funds available instantly in your Binance spot wallet. However, you will not be receiving the daily reward for the day of redemption.

Standard redemption (prioritize rewards): A standard redemption will make your funds available in your Binance spot wallet the next day. By choosing this option, you will receive the daily reward that accrued on the day you submitted the redemption request.

The pros of flexible products: Earn rewards on coins that would otherwise be idle

You can withdraw your coins at any time with no penalties The cons of flexible products: Lower rewards than locked products

Locked products

Locked products require you to lock up your cryptocurrency for a specified period of time. Usually, the APR will be higher the longer the lock-up period is.

In our example, the estimated APR for Tezos (XTZ) at the time of writing is 5.8% for 30 days, 7.5% for 60 days, 8.79% for 90 days and 13.9% for 120 days. Please note that we’re sharing this information for illustrative purposes only, and that the offered APRs are subject to change on a daily basis depending on market conditions.

The accumulated rewards will become available to you once the lock-up period ends. If you need your funds immediately, you can redeem your subscription early. However, you will receive no rewards if you choose to redeem early.

The pros of locked products: Earn rewards on crypto that would otherwise be idle

Offers better APR than flexible products

Users have the option to redeem early Cons: If you redeem early, you will receive no rewards

How are Binance Earn rewards calculated?

Now that we understand the two basic types of Binance Simple Earn products, let’s learn a little bit about how rewards are calculated. The formula is the following:

Rewards = deposited assets * APR/365

Please note that the APR can change after you begin your subscription. The rates being offered are influenced by market conditions. If there’s low demand for lending a specific cryptocurrency, the APR will likely drop. Meanwhile, the APR could increase if there is a lot of demand for lending a specific cryptocurrency.

After you subscribe to a product, regardless of whether it’s a fixed or flexible product, your deposit will start earning rewards at 00:00 UTC the next day. Rewards will start being distributed to your Binance Spot Wallet the next day. In most cases, you will receive rewards in your spot wallet between 0:00 and 08:00 UTC every day, although there can occasionally be delays.

What you need to know about Binance Simple Earn

There are some important things you need to know about Binance Simple Earn that will allow you to use the product to its fullest potential and avoid any unpleasant surprises.

Simple Earn is a principal protected product

Binance Simple Earn is a principal protected product, which means that you will be able to withdraw the amount you deposited regardless of what happens in the market. In other words, if you deposit 1 BTC into a locked or flexible product, you will be able to withdraw at least 1 BTC even if the price of Bitcoin crashes.

This does not mean that Simple Earn is a risk-free product. You still have to trust that Binance will custody your cryptocurrency securely and not mismanage your funds in some way. Even though Binance has a strong track record on keeping its customers safe, using any cryptocurrency exchanges comes with a certain degree of risk.

The rewards rate can fluctuate daily

When you’re subscribing to a product on Binance Simple Earn, you will see the APR (Annual Percentage Rate) that’s currently being offered on deposits. However, the APR you see when you’re subscribing can change on a daily basis, depending on market conditions.

So, while you can use the current rate to get a rough estimate of how much in rewards you will earn on your deposit, keep in mind that the APR will most likely change throughout the duration of your subscription.

Tiered APRs

For some cryptocurrencies, Binance has a Tiered APR system in place in which the offered interest rate depends on how much cryptocurrency you are depositing. In practice, this means that larger deposits earn less interest.

You can identify products with a Tiered APR by the “Tier Rate” tag under the current APR. Here’s an example of how it looks for Bitcoin:

You can withdraw early from locked products

If you deposited your funds in a locked product, but need access to them immediately, there is an option to redeem your funds at any time. However, if you choose to do so, you will not receive any rewards that accrued during the duration of your subscription.

The bottom line—a simple way of growing your crypto holdings

Binance Simple Earn is a great product for those who are holding their cryptocurrency for the long term, and want to earn crypto without taking on any major risks. While an active trading style can bring more profits, it also has the potential for bigger losses. Simple Earn, on the other hand, allows you to earn a yield with principal protection, and you also have the freedom to withdraw your funds at any time.

Flexible products allow you to withdraw your funds at any time while still keeping your rewards, but they offer lower APRs than locked products. Locked products offer higher APRs, but you need to have your funds locked up for the entire duration if you want to earn rewards.

article_title: Updated List of the Top 10 Richest People in the World - Watcher Guru
text:
The fascination with the economic elite is seemingly never-ending, and Forbes real-time list of billionaires reflects its current state. It is that list that has given us the Top 10 richest people in the world.

Some of the most influential names on the planet adorn the list. As we take a look at some of the biggest billionaires in the world, we see one name sitting atop of them all once again.

World's Top 10 Richest People:



🇺🇸 Elon Musk: $202.5B

🇫🇷 Bernard Arnault: $157.2B

🇮🇳 Gautam Adani: $142.2B

🇺🇸 Jeff Bezos: $112.8B

🇺🇸 Warren Buffet: $101.4B

🇺🇸 Bill Gates: $100.5B

🇺🇸 Larry Ellison: $99.4B

🇮🇳 Mukesh Ambani: $92B

🇲🇽 Carlos Slim: $86.1B

🇺🇸 Michael Bloomberg: $76.8B November 7, 2022

Elon Musk remains the richest person in the world

Following a $44 billion acquisition of the most popular social media platform on the planet, Elon Musk is still the world’s richest person. Ahead of some of the most well-known entities in business sits the Tesla co-founder. Musk owns a net worth of $202.5 billion, with a $45 billion gap between him and the second-richest individual.

Set just behind Space X and Twitter CEO, however, is Bernard Arnault at $157.2 billion. Arnault is the CEO and Chairman of LVMH, one of the premier names in luxury goods. As a fixture on the list, Arnault is the richest man in Europe.

GRUENHEIDE, GERMANY – MARCH 22: Tesla CEO Elon Musk speaks during the official opening of the new Tesla electric car manufacturing plant on March 22, 2022 near Gruenheide, Germany. The new plant, officially called the Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg, is producing the Model Y as well as electric car batteries. (Photo by Christian Marquardt – Pool/Getty Images)

The third-richest person on the planet is Gautam Adani. Currently, he is the richest man in Asia with a net worth of $142.2 billion. The Indian businessman is president of the Adani Foundation.

Four Americans follow the top ten list, with Jeff Bezos leading the pack. Moreover, the Amazon founder has a net worth of $112.8 billion and sits ahead of Warren Buffet, Bill Gates, and Larry Ellison.

Source: Bloomberg.com

Buffet and Gates round out the list of triple-figure earners, with both sporting a net worth of $101.4 billion and $100.5 billion, respectively. Following closely is Oracle chairman and co-founder Larry Ellison with $99.4 Billion.

The list of the 10 richest people in the world concludes with Mukesh Ambani, Carlos Slim, and Michael Bloomberg with net worths above $75 billion.

article_title: What the FTX collapse means for the future of crypto - Forkast News
text:
The FTX scandal continues sending shockwaves throughout the cryptocurrency industry. Few could predict that the highly-regarded centralized exchange (CEX) would implode, leaving vulnerable retail investors to bear the brunt of the catastrophe. Thousands of FTX users were unable to pull their funds off of the exchange when insolvency rumors began to swell, and now may never be refunded. The collapse has underscored the vital importance for crypto users to be able to transact quickly and efficiently across platforms.

So what’s next for the crypto industry? CEXs adopting “proof of reserves” is simply not enough to win back users. In order to restore user trust, there are a few important steps that platforms can, and must, take. In light of the uncertainty of centralized finance (CeFi), users need ways to transact and move funds with ease and security more than ever before. Individuals must be empowered to take control of their crypto keys. While CEXs are convenient and boast a superior user experience, they should not be used to house long-term investments. Amid the FTX fallout, we are witnessing a massive migration from CeFi to decentralized finance (DeFi), but in order to both onboard and retain users, there must be assurances that they will be able to securely off-ramp and withdraw assets quickly.

Uptick in DeFi user activity post-FTX

Crypto users are transacting at heavy volumes in the wake of the FTX disaster, seeking out safe harbors for their assets.

For example, Uniswap — one of DeFi’s most popular decentralized exchanges (DEXs) — recently surpassed Coinbase for daily trading volume on Ethereum pairs. Moreover, research firm Delphi Digital found that centralized exchanges experienced a net US$5.5 billion outflow on Ethereum from exchanges over 7 days in mid-November, coupled with its DEX basket rising 33.8% compared to BTC.

The case for fast self-custody

Centralized crypto exchanges will still serve an important purpose in the ecosystem for some time to come, but perhaps not forever. In fact, a Binance executive recently stated its CEX may not exist in 10 years because of the macro movement toward DeFi. To that end, we simply cannot afford to overlook what DEXs bring to the table in terms of security and autonomy. Both CEXs and DEXs have their own laundry lists of pros and cons, and users must be discerning when choosing where and how to store their crypto to meet their specific needs.

In the wake of FTX’s collapse, the classic catchphrase “not your keys, not your crypto” rings truer than ever. The danger of keeping your assets on a centralized exchange is that your ability to access your crypto is fully dependent on the exchange’s ability to transfer it to you. In a crisis of confidence, investors may panic, attempting to pull all their funds quickly and essentially cause a run on the exchange.

Non-custodial wallets are a great option for those wanting top-notch security. There are two types of non-custodial wallets: hardware and software. Both store the private crypto keys, strings of numbers and letters that resemble a highly-sensitive password. Non-custodial options ensure that the user has complete ownership over their assets. Custodial wallets are easier for crypto novices to adopt, however, the private keys are held by a third party which can come with risk.

The key to DeFi: improving user experience

Most crypto users, especially novices, have typically gravitated towards CEXs for convenience and user experience reasons. In order to both onboard and retain more users, the glaring DeFi user experience issues must be addressed.

One of the largest barriers to mass adoption of DeFi is the lack of a seamless and secure on-and-off-ramping process. If key DeFi entities are able to perfect the entry and exit points to and from their platforms, they will facilitate a much more approachable and accessible experience for all users.

Above all else, there must be trust in user autonomy over assets, no matter the platform. Ultimately, the industry can restore trust amid the FTX catastrophe by making crypto more accessible — and transactions faster. While the macro-economic environment remains a devastating one for retail investors and the crypto community at large, the Web3 revolution is still very much poised to overtake legacy finance.

article_title: Why is it Advisable to Bet With Crypto from Florida - CoinCodex
text:
Offshore internet casino platforms have filled the void left by Florida's inability to develop a regulated market for online gambling. The state of Florida is still working hard to develop this industry. In the state of Florida, the only method to participate in online gambling for real money is through these platforms.

In the past few years, cryptocurrencies have spread all over the world, and they are only enjoying more adoption as time goes on. Naturally, despite their status as highly inventive sub-sectors of the entertainment business, online betting and gaming have not been unfamiliar with the rise of cryptocurrency until recently.

Nearly every day, there is the launch of a new cryptocurrency-based betting website, which provides online gamblers with more lucrative opportunities than their offline counterparts.

Sports Betting Legality in Florida

Once Governor DeSantis as well as the Seminole Tribe of Florida struck a deal in 2021, it seemed like things were looking good for the sports betting industry in the state of Florida. The compact authorized the Tribe to conduct online and retail sports betting. A month later, as a direct consequence of this, the Tribe released its betting app. In spite of this, a federal judge found that the Florida-Seminole Gaming Compact was in violation of the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act after a number of cases were filed (IGRA).

As a result, the Tribe pulled its mobile app early in the month of December, despite the fact that it had only been offering legal sports gambling in the province for a period of five weeks. As a result of the overturn of the gaming agreement, sports betting in Florida will not resume in either the online or retail settings until 2023.

Nevertheless, punters in the Sunshine State are able to legally visit online offshore sportsbooks such as those that are listed in this guide in order to place wagers on the sports that they like watching the most.

Since these sportsbooks have their headquarters outside of the United States, they really aren't subject to the gambling regulations that apply within the United States, which places them in legal limbo. Players in Florida are therefore free to use these websites without fear of running afoul of the law (Source: https://techreport.com/florida-sports-betting/).

Privacy and Security

Traditional currencies do not offer the same levels of security that cryptocurrency does, which is one of the most significant advantages of cryptocurrencies in general. Because cryptocurrencies are unregulated, users have a greater degree of control over their financial resources while making wagers on athletic events.

Higher Withdrawal and Betting Limits

The answer to this question will differ from one bookmaker to the next; nevertheless, the vast majority of sportsbooks will let gamblers make higher withdrawals and wagers when they use cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. You still have to use common sense and avoid getting sidetracked, but if you've got the cash to spend and don't want to be limited by betting limitations, crypto is typically the way to go.

Transaction Speed Increases

When betting on sports with cryptocurrency, you have the added benefit of being able to make bets and make withdrawals more quickly than when using conventional kinds of currency. Even though the majority of online sportsbooks are normally quite quick when it comes to concluding transactions, the process of withdrawing the money can still take some time when banking and security laws are taken into consideration.

On the other hand, as soon as you have the cryptocurrencies of your choice in your digital wallet, you are able to make deposits using that cryptocurrency and place bets. It should come as no surprise that bookmakers are able to send your earnings directly to you as swiftly as possible. Digital wallets are gaining massive popularity lately and it’s not just in the gambling sector, studies are showing that more than half of all online shopping will be done by digital wallets in the near future.

Bigger Bonuses

The majority of the time, bonuses and special deals may be found at online sportsbooks. There are many of these that are open to everyone who wishes to place a wager but there are also many of these that are only available to people who are gambling with cryptocurrencies, especially in 2022. If you stick with cryptocurrency while putting bets and you know where to seek it, you still might make even more money on bonuses.

Low Risk Value

Finally, when compared to wagering with regular money, betting with cryptocurrency typically has a lower level of risk. There is always an element of danger involved when trading cryptocurrencies, but the majority of online sportsbooks will change your cryptocurrency holdings into US dollars whenever you place a wager on a game.

Cryptocurrency is notoriously volatile. You are protected from the inherent volatility of crypto assets simply by virtue of this fact alone. After a significant win, you won't have to be concerned about the worth of your gains suddenly decreasing for no apparent reason. However, you will still need to exercise caution whenever you place a wager on anything; however, at least you will not have to worry about this happening.

article_title: NFT Scoring - What is NFT Rarity Checker? - CoinCodex
text:
An NFT rarity checker allows you to check the relative rarity of an NFT in the context of the NFT collection it belongs to. For example, you could use an NFT rarity checker tool to determine how rare the traits of a specific CryptoPunk are compared to all the other NFTs in the CryptoPunks collection.

NFTs are unique digital assets that can represent unique objects such as digital collectibles, art, video game items, or even real-world items. Carrying a unique metadata, these digital assets provide a simple technology to prove the authenticity of something. There are tens of thousands of NFT collections that serve different purposes, and users store their NFTs in NFT wallets such as Enjin wallet. Users can choose between Ethereum NFTs, Solana NFTs, Polygon NFTs and many other blockchain platforms.

In this industry, which is growing and reaching a huge user base, some NFTs are much more valuable than others and can be sold for millions of dollars. Before buying an NFT, investors look for answers to questions such as what determines the value of NFT and how to check NFT rarity ranking. In this content, we will give various suggestions on how to check an NFT’s rarity score and briefly introduce the platforms that serve in this area.

What is NFT rarity score?

One of the most important factors to consider when evaluating an NFT is its rarity. NFT rarity refers to how unique that NFT is among all NFTs in the collection. Generally speaking, NFTs with higher rarity will fetch a higher price in the market, but it’s important to understand that there has to be demand for the NFT collection the NFT belongs to—rarity by itself is not a guarantee that an NFT is desirable. Rare NFTs from collections like CryptoPunks and Bored Ape Yacht Club have sold for millions of dollars.

NFTs with rare features sell for a higher price and can offer their owners benefits not found in other NFTs. Owning a high rarity NFT also comes with some bragging rights, which some people will value more than others.

What are the most popular NFT rarity checker websites?

Determining the rarity of an NFT is simplified by dedicated online tools, which we will explore a bit further below. These websites use three basic methods when calculating NFT rarity. Three different calculation methods, Average Trait Rarity, Trait Rarity Ranking, and Statistical Rarity, calculate how rare the NFT's properties are compared to all the NFTs in the collection.

The three most popular service websites for NFT scoring and rarity check are Rarity Sniper, rarity.tools, and Rarity Sniffer.

Rarity Sniper

Rarity Sniper is a project that started with a few developers creating a simple tool for NFT sniping. Later, with the Discord servers reaching more than 250 thousand users, the tool was further developed and a public NFT rarity tool was released. The website is able to sort NFTs in their collection of over 1000 NFTs by rarity.

There are many features on the website, such as upcoming NFT drops, the ability to search collections by properties, collection statistics, and new NFT collections. Rarity Sniper has also added a Buy Now button for NFTs in OpenSea. For more info about the leading NFT rarity checker platform, check out our Rarity Sniper review.

Rarity.tools

Rarity.tools is a platform that can sort collectible NFTs by rarity. This platform, which can be used to determine how rare any NFT in the collection is, allows us to compare NFTs with each other.

A Rarity Score is given for each feature of the NFT in rarity.tools. When the rarity scores of all traits are added together, the NFT reaches a final NFT score, and the rarity scores of all NFTs in the collection are ranked from highest to lowest. Rarity.tools has a customized scoring system for each collection. The flagship feature of the platform is Top Bottom Matching.

Rarity Sniffer

The Rarity Sniffer is one of the first NFT rarity checkers released. Supporting new collections almost every day, Rarity Sniffer has added collections to its homepage, making it easier to check for rarity.

More than 10,000 collections are listed on Rarity Sniffer as of November 2022. If you want to check NFT rarity but can't find a website that supports the collection, you should definitely take a look at Rarity Sniffer. The trending NFT platform claims to have the largest archive of NFT collections on the web.

How to check NFT rarity?

Rarity checker NFT tools usually calculate the rarity according to the Rarity Score approach. Rarity checkers, which calculate the properties and density of all NFTs within a collection with an advanced algorithm, give each NFT a reliable rarity score. There can be more than 1000x price difference between two NFTs in a collection. That's why before buying an NFT, it's a good idea to check how much it should cost with a tool like rarity.tools.

Let's learn about the rarity of an NFT in the CryptoPunks NFT collection by going to the rarity.tools website. This step-by-step guide will give you a better understanding of how the NFT scoring and ranking process works.

When we enter the website, we can see the All Collections section by scrolling down a bit. Here we can sort the NFT collections according to 10 different filtering methods, and see the statistics of the collection by searching by project name. I choose the CryptoPunks collection.

When we enter the collection page, there are options in the left navigation bar that allow us to make detailed filters. In the middle section, we can change the ranking method and decide for ourselves how to rank the NFTs. We can also customize applied weightings. The common NFT rarity check methods are Rarity Score, Trait Rarity, Statistical Rarity, and Average Rarity.

To measure the rarity score of the albino female CryptoPunk #9876 with hat and pink hair, purple lipstick and eye patch, I type the NFT ID in the left navigation bar.

NFT scored 178.09 with rarity.tools v2 measurements. This makes the NFT the 818th rarest NFT in the collection. When I make the same measurement with the rarity.tools v1 method, the NFT is the 798th NFT at its rarest. Considering there are 10,000 NFTs in the collection, 818 isn't a bad ranking.

In the interface we can also see the Punk Type Value of the collection and many useful charts.

Final thoughts

There are many different tools that allow us to know how rare an NFT is before we buy an NFT. Every rarity tool and calculation method are useful and can prevent you from overpaying for an NFT. Rarity.tools has become the most popular NFT scores tool thanks to its filtering and statistics features.

You can use these tools to potentially find rare NFTs that can be acquired for a good price. Each of these tools is free, which may come in handy on your next gem NFT hunt. When you find the right analysis tools and know how to use them, you can start making more profitable investments.
